title: 'Nirantar' Nitish Kumar: Why 'Sushasan Babu' remains Bihar's most indispensable leader
content: Nitish Kumar secures an unprecedented tenth term as Bihar's Chief Minister, demonstrating remarkable political resilience. Despite numerous alliance shifts and criticisms, he has once again swept the state, shattering notions of age-related fatigue. His consistent victory, attributed to strategic governance and welfare initiatives, solidifies his position as a dominant force in Bihar's politics.

title: Return of kingmaker: Nitish sworn in as Bihar CM - list of ministers who took oath
content: At a vibrant ceremony, Nitish Kumar was officially sworn in as Chief Minister of Bihar for the 10th occasion, with Prime Minister Narendra Modi in attendance to witness the momentous occasion. This inauguration heralds the establishment of a new NDA government following their sweeping success in the 2025 Assembly elections.

title: 'Sorry mom': 10th student jumps to death; massive protest outside Delhi school
content: A 16-year-old student died by suicide, leaving a note alleging harassment by teachers. The note, found in his school bag, detailed his distress and requested action against the educators. His father's FIR corroborates the claims of continuous mental torment over minor issues, prompting protests by students and parents demanding accountability.

title: Hardik Pandya's injury update: Comeback delayed; set to miss ODI series vs SA
content: Hardik Pandya’s return to competitive cricket has been pushed back by a few days, ruling him out of the upcoming ODI series against South Africa. The all-rounder, who was initially expected to rejoin Baroda for the early rounds of the Syed Mushtaq Ali Trophy, will now link up with his state side only at the end of the month, which is part of a carefully managed comeback plan after nearly two months on the sidelines.

title: Trump’s tariff exemptions for 200 goods: How agro exports will benefit from US move
content: The US has removed tariffs on over 200 food items, including tea, coffee, and spices. This move is expected to boost Indian agricultural exports, creating a more level playing field. Indian exporters anticipate increased demand and better market access.

title: AI bubble warning: Google CEO says no AI company is immune
content: Google CEO Sundar Pichai has warned of "elements of irrationality" in the current AI investment boom, stating no company will be immune if a bubble bursts. He compared the situation to the dotcom era, emphasizing AI's profound importance despite potential market corrections. Pichai expressed confidence in Google's ability to navigate turbulence due to its comprehensive infrastructure.

title: 'Failed to explain to people of Bihar': Prashant Kishor holds 'maun vrat'
content: Jan Suraaj supremo Prashant Kishor observed a day-long maun vrat at Bihar's Bhitiharwa Gandhi Ashram following his party's electoral defeat. Kishor took full responsibility for the Jan Suraaj's poor performance, vowing to work harder to fulfill his resolve to improve Bihar.  Meanwhile, Nitish Kumar was sworn in as Chief Minister for a record tenth time.

title: IND vs SA: Shubman Gill yet to return to nets; green tinge Guwahati surface under spotlight
content: Preparations for the second Test in Guwahati are underway, with the Barsapara Cricket Stadium pitch showing a green tinge. Shubman Gill, recovering from a neck spasm, may join practice tomorrow. The red soil pitch is expected to offer pace and bounce, aiming for a balanced surface after Kolkata's criticism.

title: OpenAI exec’s message to Zuckerberg: Claims ex-firm Meta not doing well; 2 focus areas
content: OpenAI's Apps CEO, Fidji Simo, formerly of Meta, highlights her former employer's failure to foresee product-induced societal risks. At OpenAI, she's prioritizing mental health and job disruption, acknowledging the uncharted territory.  She detailed efforts to curb negative mental health responses and protect teens, while admitting the difficulty of perfectly identifying issues like mania.

title: Bryce Dunlap’s sudden death leaves fans with unanswered questions and grief
content: Bryce Dunlap, a 21-year-old Cleveland Browns fan, died from an anoxic brain injury following a sudden respiratory and cardiac emergency. His family honored his wish to donate organs, leading to a successful liver transplant for former Browns quarterback Bernie Kosar. The community has rallied in support, exceeding fundraising goals for his memorial.

title: Not a 1st-timer: Another Al-Falah grad wanted in 2008 serial blasts; now in Pak
content: Mirza Shadab Baig, a key accused in the 2008 Delhi and Ahmedabad serial bombings, remains at large and is believed to be in Pakistan. Baig, who headed the Azamgarh module of the Indian Mujahideen, was instrumental in merging terror groups and conducting recce operations. His network linked both serial bombings, which resulted in numerous casualties.

title: Giving up land, some weapons: A setback for Kyiv? What Trump’s Russia–Ukraine peace plan proposes
content: The US has reportedly proposed a peace framework for Ukraine, suggesting territorial concessions and military capacity reductions. This diplomatic push aims to end the conflict, though Ukraine's involvement in shaping the plan is unclear. While Moscow maintains its demands, Turkey is again offering mediation, highlighting the complex path to peace.

title: Tech firm whose founder beat Musk as world's richest for a day loses 30% market value
content: Larry Ellison briefly surpassed Elon Musk in wealth after a surge in Oracle's stock, driven by a massive OpenAI cloud deal. However, Oracle's value has since plummeted, erasing those gains and leaving Musk firmly back in the top spot. Investors are now cautious about Oracle's AI-dependent strategy and high valuations.

title: Klimt portrait sells for $236.4 million, second highest auction price ever
content: Gustav Klimt's "Portrait of Elisabeth Lederer" fetched a staggering $236.4 million, becoming the second most expensive painting ever sold at auction. This rare, full-length portrait, surviving wartime upheaval, captivated collectors with its rich detail and historical significance. The intense bidding war highlights the enduring demand for early 20th-century masterpieces with compelling stories and limited availability.

title: 'Against elasticity': SC says can't impose timelines on President, Governor to act on Bills; key points
content: The Supreme Court will soon deliver its verdict on a presidential reference concerning timelines for President and governors' assent to state bills. The reference, invoking Article 143(1), seeks clarity on judicial powers to mandate deadlines for constitutional functionaries, impacting Centre-state relations amid ongoing legislative disputes.

title: Hailee Steinfeld mocked as outfit sparks pregnancy rumors among NFL fans
content: Hailee Steinfeld's sculptural Stéphane Rolland gown at the 2025 Governors Awards sparked widespread pregnancy speculation online. The dress's exaggerated silhouette, particularly the structured waist, led fans to theorize it was designed to conceal a baby bump. Steinfeld has not commented on the rumors, instead sharing details about hosting Thanksgiving with Josh Allen.

title: Taylor Swift’s new song sparks Joe Alwyn breakup buzz, not Travis Kelce
content: Taylor Swift's new song, 'The Fate of Ophelia,' is fueling fan theories linking it to her breakup with Joe Alwyn.  Swifties interpret lyrics about rescue and rebirth as a nod to her current relationship, contrasting it with her past. The track is seen as Taylor Swift reclaiming her narrative, transforming heartbreak into art.

title: Video sparks allegations of Trevon Diggs’ role in violent elevator encounter
content: Surveillance footage has surfaced regarding an elevator altercation in Los Angeles, allegedly involving individuals connected to the Diggs family. While Trevon Diggs isn't officially charged, a civil suit names him, and his brother Darez has faced legal action. The victim claims robbery and assault, sparking intense scrutiny.

title: IND vs SA: Pant poised to enter exclusive Dhoni club, to become only second wicketkeeper to …
content: Rishabh Pant will captain India in the second Test against South Africa, becoming the second wicketkeeper to lead the nation in Tests after MS Dhoni. The match in Guwahati features adjusted timings, with play starting 30 minutes earlier to maximize daylight due to the city's eastern location and early sunsets.

title: Trump sanctions: India looks at Middle-East for oil imports; pulls away from Russian crude
content: With US sanctions on the horizon, Indian oil refineries are redirecting their focus to the Middle East for crude oil supplies. A noticeable rise in tanker bookings from Saudi Arabia, Kuwait, Iraq, and the UAE highlights a major transformation in their sourcing strategy.

title: Nashik horror: Boy crushed as MSRTC bus ploughs into passengers; act caught on cam
content: A tragic accident occurred at Sinnar bus stand when an MSRTC bus lost control and crashed into the platform, resulting in the death of a nine-year-old boy and injuries to several others. CCTV footage captured the chaotic scene as passengers scrambled to safety. Preliminary investigations suggest brake failure as the cause of the incident.

title: Chess WC: Meet China's no. 1 Wei Yi — slayer of India's last hope, Arjun Erigaisi
content: India's top player Arjun Erigaisi faced a heartbreaking defeat in the FIDE World Cup 2025 tie-break against China's Wei Yi, ending his dream of a Candidates 2026 berth. Wei Yi, a rising star, now carries China's hopes for a maiden World Cup title. India's Candidates qualification now hinges on R Praggnanandhaa.

title: 'Rohit-Kohli were pushed out': Ex-India cricketer blasts Gambhir after India's loss at Eden
content: Manoj Tiwary has strongly criticized the team management, alleging a "manufactured transition narrative" pushed Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli out of Test cricket despite their desire to continue. He also faulted coach Gautam Gambhir for blaming player technique after a batting collapse, stating the coach should focus on training and taking responsibility for poor results.

title: ‘Terror doc network’ trail: Cops detain Al-Falah MBBS student; 'links' to Delhi blast
content: Delhi Police and UP ATS detained Ahmed Raza, an MBBS student, in Deoband as part of the Delhi blast conspiracy probe. Raza, a suspected associate of the deceased Dr. Umar, was in contact with other arrested accused, expanding the multi-state investigation into the terror module.

title: Bengaluru heist: Gang posing as ‘RBI officials’ loot Rs 7cr from cash van in 30 mins — how the drama unfolded
content: Five to six miscreants, posing as RBI officials, executed a daring daylight dacoity in Bengaluru, looting Rs 7.1 crore from an armoured cash van. The well-scripted incident involved blocking the van, deceiving its staff, and making off with the cash boxes under the guise of an inspection.

title: Infosys share buyback: IT services giant’s biggest Rs 18,000 crore offer opens today
content: Infosys' largest-ever share buyback, valued at Rs 18,000 crore, commenced today and will conclude on November 26. Shareholders approved the repurchase of up to 10 crore shares at ₹1,800 each, with a reserved quota for small shareholders. Promoters will not participate in this buyback.

title: 4 early warning signs of colorectal cancer that appear in poop
content: Colorectal cancer is a serious health issue, affecting more young people. Early detection is vital for survival. Changes in stool, like thinness, mucus, or blood, can be warning signs. Persistent changes in bowel habits also require attention. Lifestyle factors contribute to the rising risk. Prompt medical evaluation is essential.

title: Global markets 2026: India shines in Goldman Sachs AM’s emerging markets outlook
content: Goldman Sachs Asset Management highlights India as a prime investment opportunity for 2026, citing robust GDP growth, resilient corporate earnings, and a burgeoning consumer base. The report emphasizes India's youthful demographic, accelerating digital transformation, and its role in global innovation, making it a compelling destination for investors seeking quality growth.

title: New ‘star factory’ galaxy produces stars 180 times faster than Milky Way
content: Astronomers have discovered an unusually bright and warm galaxy, MACS0416_Y1, dating back to just 600 million years after the Big Bang. This early galaxy is forming stars at an astonishing rate, challenging previous beliefs about galactic evolution. Its intense infrared glow, powered by heated dust, suggests rapid development and efficient star formation in the nascent universe.

title: Tactical projectiles, Javelin missile system: US clears major arms sale to India
content: India is set to receive a significant defense upgrade from the United States with an approved $93 million arms deal. This package includes advanced Javelin Missile Systems and Excalibur tactical projectiles, bolstering India's homeland defense and its ability to counter regional threats. The sale reinforces the strategic partnership between the two nations, enhancing security in the Indo-Pacific.

title: Ayesha Curry earns nomination at 2025 Glossy Beauty and Wellness Awards
content: Ayesha Curry's beauty brand, Sweet July Skin, has earned a nomination for Best Category Launch at the 2025 Glossy Beauty and Wellness Awards for its successful Lip Treatment. This recognition follows previous accolades for the brand, highlighting its growing impact in the beauty industry. The winners will be revealed on December 2, 2025.

title: Canada’s study, work permit delays deepen for Indian applicants despite real-time tracking shift
content: Indian applicants are seeing mixed trends in Canada’s latest visa processing updates. Study permits from India now take around four weeks, but in-Canada extensions still stretch to 12 weeks. Work permits remain steady at ten weeks, while extensions inside Canada face delays of nearly eight months. IRCC’s real-time tracking boosts transparency but offers little relief from uneven processing timelines.

title: 'Felt like a champion': Samson's emotional leap into CSK’s iconic yellow - watch
content: Sanju Samson embraces the vibrant yellow of Chennai Super Kings, bursting with elation following a high-profile trade that has set the cricket world abuzz. Leaving Rajasthan Royals behind, he welcomes an exciting new chapter, accompanied by the exit of renowned players Ravindra Jadeja and Sam Curran.

title: Ivy League isn’t everything: Instagram CEO reveals the 2 qualities driving top AI talent
content: AI talent is in high demand. Instagram CEO Adam Mosseri highlights scrappiness and rapid learning as key traits for top AI engineers.  Traditional degrees are less important than hands-on experience.  This shift offers new opportunities for aspiring professionals in the evolving AI field.  Competition for these skilled individuals is intense.

title: Price prediction: Why Rs 1,22,000 is an important level for gold investors?
content: Gold and silver price prediction today: Gold prices are poised to climb towards Rs 1,27,000, with a stop loss at Rs 1,22,000 advised. Silver is also showing strength, aiming for Rs 1,65,800, but a Rs 1,55,500 stop loss is crucial. Investors should monitor upcoming US economic data for potential market volatility.

title: IND vs SA: The curious case of Washington Sundar - No.3 batter or bowling allrounder?
content: India's coach Gautam Gambhir is considering Sai Sudharsan for the No. 3 batting spot, potentially impacting Washington Sundar's role. Sundar impressed against spin in the first Test, but Sudharsan's front-foot technique against spinners is being honed. The team faces a dilemma in balancing batting and bowling contributions.

title: Nagpur robbery: Manager loots own bank of Rs 1.58cr to clear debt; held within 24 hours
content: A bank manager orchestrated a daring solo heist. Mayur Nepale stole over Rs1.5 crore from his bank's strongroom. He was driven by crippling gambling debts. Nepale attempted to stage the crime as an external burglary. However, CCTV footage captured him arriving on his scooter. Police quickly identified and arrested him. Assets worth over Rs1 crore were recovered.

title: 'Didn't want nuclear dust over LA': Trump takes credit for India-Pak truce again
content: US President Donald Trump claimed he averted a nuclear war between India and Pakistan by threatening a 350% tariff on both nations. He stated his intervention prevented conflict, though India has denied any third-party involvement in the bilateral ceasefire.

title: Fortnite down: Server issues, PS5, Xbox & PC not working - Explained
content: Fortnite experienced unexpected downtime on November 19th, affecting players across all platforms. This outage, lasting approximately 1.5 to 2 hours, occurred due to a major update rollout by Epic Games. Common issues included login failures, matchmaking errors, and game crashes, with solutions involving console restarts, cache clearing, and game reinstallation.

title: A toilet named ‘America’? Fully functional 18-karat gold toilet sold for over $12M at auction
content: A fully functional 18-karat gold toilet, titled 'America', has fetched over $12 million at auction. Created by artist Maurizio Cattelan, the opulent loo, weighing 101 kg, was purchased by Ripley's Believe It or Not!. This satirical artwork, previously displayed at the Guggenheim and infamously stolen from the UK, challenges perceptions of wealth and art value.

title: 'Orry' summoned by police in drug case; 'Lavish' says he organised rave parties for celebs
content: Mumbai Police's Anti-Narcotics Cell has summoned social media influencer Orry in a Rs 252-crore drug case. This follows revelations by arrested drug supplier Mohammed Salim Sohail Shaikh, who allegedly organized parties attended by Bollywood celebrities and coordinated drug manufacturing and trafficking across several Indian states.

title: 'Student death after 100 sit-ups: Teacher held, probe cites she ‘knew of ailments’
content: A Vasai teacher was arrested for culpable homicide after a 13-year-old student died following a punishment of 100 sit-ups with her bag. The student, who had known health issues, suffered lung swelling, according to the postmortem. The school also faces scrutiny for operating illegally and lacking infrastructure.

title: Megan Thee Stallion spent $240K on therapy after Klay Thompson deepfake incident
content: Grammy-winning rapper Megan Thee Stallion is seeking $240,000 in therapy costs as part of her defamation lawsuit against blogger Milagro Gramz.  Testimony revealed the immense psychological toll of online harassment, including a deepfake video, leading to a PTSD diagnosis.  The trial highlights the devastating impact of digital attacks on celebrities.

title: RBI rate: Amundi urges 50 bps cut over 12 months; warns US tariffs may slow growth
content: Amundi, the French asset manager, advises that India's central bank should consider a 50 basis point interest rate cut over the next year. They fear that economic momentum may wane in 2026 due to potential US tariffs. However, robust domestic demand and anticipated fiscal measures, such as adjustments to GST and reductions in income tax, could bolster growth.

title: Meeting Centre’s deadline to make Andhra free from left-wing extremism by March 2026: DGP Harish Kumar Gupta
content: “CPI (Maoist) general secretary Devuji is not in our custody; the Operation Sambhav has eliminated key Maoists in the two encounters in Maredumilli agency,” DGP said

title: Telangana CM discusses collaboration opportunities with Analog AI CEO
content: Analog AI was keen on addressing issues like traffic congestion, urban flooding and climate change prediction for Hyderabad city using their cutting edge tech platforms, said the CEO

title: LJP(RV)'s rise fulfils father's dream, says Chirag Paswan after two party MLAs take oath as Ministers
content: Today is a day to remember Ram Vilas Paswan ji and to work towards developing Bihar. It is a big day, and on this day, I first remember my leader and my father, the respected Ram Vilas Paswan ji, says Chirag Paswan

title: Telangana’s Wanaparthy Collector increases senior citizen allowance when ₹5,000 was not paid by their children
content: In some cases, Wanaparthy Collector issued orders to pay double of the ̥Rs. 5,000 allowance earlier ordered to pay

title: Sabarimala gold theft case: SIT questioning former TDB president A. Padmakumar
content: Though there is no official confirmation on the proceedings, it is suspected that Padmakumar’s arrest may be recorded after the interrogation

title: After Kerala HC order, Travancore Devaswom Board caps Sabarimala spot bookings at 5,000 per day
content: While spot booking will be available at Nilackal and Vandiperiyar, booking centres at Pampa, Erumely, and Chengannur have been suspended. Restrictions on spot bookings will remain in place till November 24

title: Citizen scientists track the pond herons mysterious night flights on India’s East coast
content: New citizen-science data from Visakhapatnam suggests that pond herons and cattle egrets may be undertaking regular seasonal journeys along the East coast, reviving a 30-year-old mystery from Chennai

title: Three killed, four injured as speeding car crashes into truck in MP’s Guna district
content: The other two injured persons are being treated at the Guna district hospital. The deceased have been identified as Akash (22), Namo Narayan (24) and Manish Jatav (25).

title: Redeveloped flower markets at Gandhi Bazaar and Malleswaram in Bengaluru to open soon with Multi Level Car Parking
content: While the two MLCPs in traditional market hubs of Bengaluru, where parking is a crisis, is a welcome addition, a question mark remains over their efficacy

title: Maredumilli encounter: Families claim mortal remains of Madvi Hidma, his wife Raje
content: Alluri Sitarama Raju District Superintendent of Police Amit Bardar told The Hindu, “The post-mortem has been conducted in Rampachodavaram Area Hospital”

title: Traffic police propose new tech for Multi Level Car Parking at 66 places in Bengaluru
content: This follows a recent meeting over the parking crisis in Bengaluru, and directions issued to BTP and civic officials to come up with solutions for the same

title: Watch: Is the SIR 2.0 deadline realistic? Here’s why officials disagree
content: India’s Special Intensive Revision is updating voter rolls after nearly two decades, but the nationwide drive has sparked protests and intense pressure on booth-level officers. This explainer unpacks why the Election Commission is racing against time and how overworked officials say the process is pushing them to the brink.

title: Nitish Kumar sworn in as Bihar CM, 26 Ministers take oath, including one Muslim and three women
content: Altogether, 26 Cabinet Ministers took oath, out of which 14 are from BJP, eight from JD(U), two from LJP (RV) and one each from HAM (S) and RLM

title: ATM cash van ₹7.11 crore robbery in Bengaluru: Gang switched vehicles, says Karnataka Home Minister
content: The robbery took place on November 19 afternoon when the accused, posing as RBI officials, intercepted a CMS cash van near Jayanagar

title: Prashant Kishor undertakes silent fast at Gandhi Ashram in Bihar
content: He had chosen the same spot three years ago for launching a 3,500 km-long "pada yatra" that culminated in the formation of Jan Suraaj Party

title: Delhi riots case hearing LIVE: Intellectuals terrorists more dangerous than ground level ones, ASG argues for Delhi Police
content: Additional Solicitor General S.V. Raju, appearing for Delhi Police, said it had become a trend now for doctors and engineers to engage in anti-national activities

title: More than 50% pending cases before Justice Juvenile Board; JJBs not fully staffed
content: The IJR filed more than 250 RTI requests and responses from 21 States, revealing that as of October 31, 2023, JJBs had only disposed of less than half of the 1,00,904 cases

title: Remarks against Army: Supreme Court extends stay on trial court proceedings against Rahul Gandhi
content: The Bench was hearing Rahul Gandhi’s plea challenging a May 29 order of the Allahabad High Court dismissing his plea challenging the trial court’s summoning order in the case

title: University of Liverpool to set up campus at Alembic City near Whitefield in Bengaluru, admissions open
content: For the first batch, the university will offer under-graduate programmes in Computer Science, Business Management, Accounting and Finance, Biomedical Sciences, and Game Design

title: Presidential Reference: Supreme Court’s responses to President Murmu’s 14 questions
content: Here is how the Bench responded, in its 111-page opinion, to the 14 questions from President Droupadi Murmu in a Reference issued by her on May 13, 2025

title: Kumbh authority gives administrative approval for Nashik airport expansion; target March 2027
content: The airport, managed by the HAL, will be able to accommodate 1,000 passengers per hour after the expansion

title: Metro Rail proposals for Coimbatore, Madurai have discrepancies: Union Minister
content: Manohar Lal Khattar accused Chief Minister M.K. Stalin of polticising the Union government’s rejection of the Metro Rail project proposals

title: Severe setback to India's diplomacy: Congress on U.S. panel's 'Pakistan success' claim in report
content: The 2025 Annual Report is almost 800 pages long. The sections on pages 108 and 109 are simply astonishing and beyond understanding. It describes the Pahalgam terror attack of April 2025, orchestrated by Pakistan as an 'insurgent attack', says Congress leader Jairam Ramesh in a post on X

title: U.S. approves $92.8 million deal to supply Javelin missiles, Excalibur projectiles to India
content: The deals to purchase the projectiles and missiles come three days after India announced the conclusion of the first-ever long-term deal where Indian oil companies would import American LPG into the country

title: Photographic art book ‘Hampi: The Rituals of Time’ by Saibal Das launched in Bengaluru
content: H. K. Patil said Saibal Das’s book captures the rich heritage, culture and archaeology of Hampi, bringing alive an ancient civilization that was once the cynosure of all eyes

title: Presidential Reference hearings saw SC repeat it is not expected to 'overrule’ T.N. Governor case verdict
content: Incidentally, the Presidential Reference was issued merely a month, on May 13, after a Division Bench headed by Justice J.B. Pardiwala set three-month timelines for the President and the Governors to clear State Bills

title: Trump claims he threatened India, Pakistan with 350% tariffs if they didn't end conflict; ‘Modi, Sharif called me’
content: “I'm not going to have you guys shooting nuclear weapons at each other, killing millions of people and having the nuclear dust floating over Los Angeles,” Trump says he told India and Pakistan

title: CCI moves NCLAT to seek clarification in WhatsApp case
content: In November last year, the CCI imposed a penalty of ₹213.14 crore on social media major Meta with respect to the WhatsApp privacy policy update done in 2021

title: Kerala local body polls: Fed up with neglect, Mundamveli apartment residents to field own candidate
content: Residents of  P&T Apartment Complex at Mundamveli have decided to boycott candidates of all major political fronts contesting from the Mundamveli East division of Kochi Corporation

title: Hurts unfazed by reports Eagles frustrated with QB
content: Eagles quarterback Jalen Hurts, responding to recent reports that some players have grown frustrated with his play, said he'll "never run away" from holding himself accountable.

title: UConn 'got punked' as Arizona overwhelms in paint
content: Arizona flipped the script on UConn in their top-five matchup Wednesday night, taking advantage of senior center Tarris Reed Jr.'s absence to win a physical battle in the paint 71-67.

title: Braves retain Iglesias, deal for Gold Glover Dubon
content: The Braves retained veteran closer Raisel Iglesias on a one-year, $16 million deal and acquired two-time Gold Glove winner Mauricio Dubon from the Astros.

title: Lamar on injury report again, this time for ankle
content: For the second straight week, Lamar Jackson didn't practice for the Ravens on Wednesday. This time, the two-time NFL MVP is listed with an ankle injury.

title: Rodgers: Playing status will be 'a safety thing'
content: To play Sunday against the Bears, Steelers quarterback Aaron Rodgers said he has to be able to "protect" himself.

title: Jets' Boyd: 'Starting to breathe on my own now'
content: Jets cornerback Kris Boyd, who was shot in the abdomen early Sunday morning outside a Manhattan restaurant, is now in stable condition and "starting to breathe on my own now," he said Wednesday.

title: Terps land Oladotun, Williams' 1st 5-star since '17
content: Babatunde Oladotun, ranked No. 8 in the SC Next 100 for the class of 2026, committed to Maryland on Wednesday, giving coach Buzz WIlliams his first five-star recruit in nearly a decade.

title: Top seeds now set for World Cup draw, playoffs
content: The top-seeded teams for the Dec. 5 World Cup tournament draw, including Germany but not Croatia, were set Wednesday when FIFA published new rankings.

title: 📸 Cardi B, Stefon Diggs share photo of newborn
content: The Grammy Award-winning artist and girlfriend of the New England Patriots wide receiver announced their child's birth on Instagram.

title: Projecting Round 1 of next year's NFL draft: Miller finds landing spots for 32 top prospects
content: How early could Ty Simpson go? What about Makai Lemon, David Bailey and Mansoor Delane? Let's project Round 1 of the 2026 draft -- plus two trades.

content: Will Joe Burrow and Jayden Daniels play again this season? Are the Vikings worried about J.J. McCarthy? And which coaches are on the hot seat?

content: Alessia Russo boasts many qualities, but her brace vs. Real Madrid showed just how valuable she is as Arsenal's primary goal threat.

content: There are still 64 national teams that can win the FIFA World Cup next summer. Let's go through them all and rank where they stand.

content: L.A.'s blueprint to bolster a two-time defending champion will be among MLB's biggest stories this winter.

content: Devin Haney is only 26, a pound-for-pound talent and unbeaten. So why is he facing a crossroads fight against Brian Norman Jr.?

title: The running man: Josh Allen on cusp of QB history
content: The Buffalo Bills' MVP is one rushing TD away from becoming the NFL's all-time leader in rushing TDs by a QB. Will he get it Thursday?

content: Eric Moody's fantasy basketball insights you need to know about, including Donovan Mitchell's heavier workload, along with more on Reed Sheppard, Dyson Daniels and Shaedon Sharpe.

title: How will 2026 halftime stack up with the most searched Super Bowl shows?
content: Bad Bunny's Super Bowl set drawing buzz, but search data shows which halftime shows stood the test of time.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Man United eye highly rated Rennes duo
content: Manchester United are keeping tabs on Rennes duo Jérémy Jacquet and Mohamed Meite. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

title: World's Best Cities 2025-26: London Tops List, This Indian City Ranks Highest
content: London remains the world's best city for the 11th year in a row, according to a report published by Resonance Consultancy, in partnership with Ipsos.

title: RSS Chief Mohan Bhagwat Visits Manipur, Will Meet Civil Society, Leaders
content: RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat arrived in Manipur's capital Imphal this morning on a three-day visit to the border state where Meitei-Kuki ethnic violence began in May 2023.

title: PM Modi's 'Gamcha' Sign-Off After Nitish Kumar 10.0 Oath Ceremony
content: Nitish Kumar was sworn in as Bihar's chief minister for a 10th time. The swearing-in ceremony, at Patna's Gandhi Maidan, witnessed an environment of fervour as thousands gathered at the venue, waving scarves and placards featuring Kumar and PM Modi.

title: 'Cry As Much As You Want': What Teacher Told Delhi Teen Who Died By Suicide
content: The class 10 student of a leading private school in Delhi, who died by suicide earlier this week, was allegedly mocked and "ill-treated" by his teachers for a year, and was threatened with expulsion after his parents objected to their behaviour.

title: In Nitish Kumar's Bihar, Old Guard Is The New Guard
content: In Bihar, the old guard is the new guard. The narrative by some experts that a new generation of younger leaders would take over yesteryear's Bihar from the experienced hands of leaders like Nitish Kumar and Lalu Yadav has turned out wrong.

title: Trump's Green Light Of F-35s For Saudi Arabia Is Only The Beginning
content: President Donald Trump quipped that it would just take just one day for the US to approve the billions in advanced fighter jets, tanks and other weapons that Saudi Arabia's crown prince has pledged to buy. The process is a bit more complicated.

title: Selective Data Sharing, Family Integration: What The New Aadhar App Offers
content: The Unique Identification Authority of India (UIDAI) has announced a new Aadhaar app that will revolutionise identity verification in India by offering a secure, paperless alternative.

title: Bengaluru Cash Van Heist An Inside Job? New Recruits, Lapses Under Scrutiny
content: The investigation into the dramatic Rs 7 crore daylight heist in Bengaluru, where a CMS cash van was robbed on Tuesday, has intensified, with the police zeroing in on the possibility of an inside job.

title: US To Buy 10 Nuclear Reactors Using Japan's $550 Billion Pledge
content: The US government plans to buy and own as many as 10 new, large nuclear reactors that could be paid for using Japan's $550 billion funding pledge, part of a push to meet surging demand for electricity.

title: "Whatever You Need": Russia Offers "5th Generation Fighter" Tech To India
content: Ahead of Russian President Vladimir Putin's visit to India, Moscow has made a significant military proposal to New Delhi that could potentially reshape the future of Indian air power.

title: "Aaya Ji Nitishwa?" A Gandhi Maidan Rally Made Nitish-Lalu Split Official
content: Patna's Gandhi Maidan, where Nitish Kumar will take the oath as Bihar's Chief Minister for a record 10th time, has been a witness to key turning points in history

title: Flat In Delhi, Ford EcoSport: A Look At Nitish Kumar's Rs 1.64-Crore Assets
content: Bihar Chief Minister-designate Nitish Kumar owns movable and immovable assets worth Rs 1.64 crore, according to his latest disclosure.

title: Matrimonial Website Shaadi Plans IPO
content: People Interactive India Pvt., operator of the popular local marriage matchmaking service Shaadi.com, is preparing for an initial public offering, according to people familiar with the matter.

title: Delhi Bomber Used To Ask Patients About Namaz Habits, Hijab In Hospital
content: The manner in which Umar Un Nabi, the doctor who carried out a suicide car bomb attack in Delhi, spoke to women patients indicated he held extreme views.

title: When Donald Trump Echoed Saudi Crown Prince's Khashoggi Denials
content: US President Donald Trump publicly defended Saudi Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman when confronted by a reporter over US intelligence findings that he had orchestrated the 2018 killing of Washington Post columnist Jamal Khashoggi.

title: Opinion: Opinion | Will Pakistan Regret Letting The Army Back At The Centre Of Power?
content: It's usually easy to know when a country has fallen to military dictatorship. Tanks on the streets, uniforms in gilded palaces, the political class interned en masse. Sometimes, however, the takeover is more subtle, more insidious.

title: Prashant Kishor Holds 'Maun Vrat' As Nitish Kumar Returns As Chief Minister
content: Jan Suraaj founder Prashant Kishor on Thursday held a silent introspection (Maun Vrat) at Bhitiharwa Gandhi Ashram in Bihar after not being able to open an account in the seats tally in the Assembly elections.

title: "Sorry Mummy...": Delhi Boy Jumps To Death From Metro Station, Blames Teachers
content: A Class 10 student in one of Delhi's leading schools has died by suicide by jumping from a Metro station and left behind a suicide note in which he has blamed his teachers.

title: Billionaire Family Turns India's Gold Obsession Into A Fortune
content: The practice of using gold as collateral for loans dates back centuries. Long before the Muthoots set up shop, small jewelers would offer cash to help clients get through rough patches.

title: Kerala local body polls: UDF will weaponise govt. policies in civic battle, says E.T. Mohammed Basheer
content: In a candid chat with The Hindu, the Indian Union Muslim League’s national organising secretary and Lok Sabha member from Malappuram asserted that State-level politics, especially the policies of the State government led by Chief Minister Pinarayi Vijayan, will be the focus of the upcoming elections

title: Kerala local body polls: No clear favourites in southern districts
content: While the ruling LDF, traditionally strong in the region, is seeking to expand its welfare projects, its opposing fronts, UDF and NDA, are inviting voters’ attention to the ‘inadequacies’ in such schemes and other hyper-local concerns

title: Kerala local body polls 2025: A keen contest in the offing in Kalamassery municipality
content: A traditional bastion of the Congress for nearly three decades, the civic body has remained in the UDF kitty. However, in the 2021 byelection the Left front gave the UDF a tough fight

title: From Awadh to Bengal: Old Lucknow to come alive in Kolkata this month
content: The heritage walk, titled Biryani and Beyond, will take place on November 29 and will be essentially a food walk where participants will get to taste traditional but lesser-known delicacies that will be accompanied with stories of migration, culture and cuisine

title: The threat of digital tradecraft in terrorism | Explained
content: A car explosion near Delhi’s Red Fort on November 10, killing at least 15 people and injuring over 30, has revealed the use of advanced digital tradecraft in terrorist attacks. This is a sobering reminder that the next frontier in counter-terrorism is not just on the physical terrain, but also in encrypted, and deeply private digital spaces

title: Presidential Reference updates: SC states it cannot impose timelines on President and Governors, opines concept of ‘deemed assent’ is alien to the Constitution
content: The Bench that heard the Presidential Reference also stated that Governors cannot sit on a Bill endlessly and in cases of prolonged inaction, limited judicial review is permissible

title: Bihar NDA Govt swearing-in highlights: Nitish Kumar takes oath as Bihar Chief Minister for a record 10th time
content: Samrat Choudhary, Vijay Kumar Sinha, Shravan Kumar, other NDA leaders take oath as Bihar Cabinet Ministers

title: New department to connect global Rajasthani diaspora with State’s progress
content: The department would lay down a policy framework to extend the benefits of the government’s schemes to NRRs and strengthen their relations with the State, Rajasthan Minister Rajyavardhan Singh Rathore said

title: Southern Railway launches QR-code grievance system to curb food quality issues
content: The system involves installation of unique QR codes in all the catering stalls; by scanning the QR code passengers are provided with essential details of the stall’s location and the station code

title: Bus tragedy: High-level Indian delegation arrives in Saudi Arabia
content: The delegation, led by Andhra Pradesh Governor Justice S. Abdul Nazeer, arrived in Madina, the Indian Embassy in Riyadh said

title: System constraints holding back probes into cyber attacks: Digital experts
content: India’s loss due to cyber fraud in 2024 surged 205.6% from 2023, cybersecurity experts said at a national conference in Gauhati University

title: Petition in Bombay High Court flags health and safety risks at BMC’s new pigeon feeding site
content: The petition challenges BMC’s interim move to allow controlled pigeon feeding at Airoli-Mulund creekside, citing health hazards and ecological risks.

title: Uttar Pradesh Education Commission faces uproar over repeated delays of TGT examination
content: Aspirants raised concerns that it was the fifth time the examination has been postponed, adding the government system is playing with future of lakhs of candidates, who are jobless and facing a bleak future wasting prime years in the hope of government jobs

title: Shia community representatives demand ticket in BMC election or will vote NOTA
content: The Mumbai Shia Youth Brigade has also written to all political parties on November 16, 2025, raising concerns regarding civic and religious matters

title: The Hindu journalists win Laadli awards for gender-sensitive reportage
content: Reports on the rape and murder of a doctor in R.G. Kar Hospital in Kolkata and a feature on transgender welfare bag accolades

title: Mallika Sarabhai’s ‘shifting cities’ act set for Hyderabad stage on November 21
content: The performance, she says, is called ‘Meanwhile, Elsewhere’ and is inspired by Italio Calvino’s book Invisible Cities, one of her favourite books

title: Red Fort blast: doctors with foreign degrees come under police scrutiny
content: Officials said both government and private healthcare facilities have been asked to provide comprehensive information on medical staff who obtained qualifications abroad, specifically degrees from Pakistan, Bangladesh, the UAE and China

title: Hidden cost of polluted groundwater
content: India needs a nationwide, real-time groundwater monitoring system with open access to data so communities know what they are drinking and irrigating with

title: Courts take cognisance of the offence, not of the offenders: Madras High Court
content: Justices S.M. Subramaniam and Mohamed Shaffiq reject a revision petition filed by an accused in a ₹1,301 crore bank loan misappropriation case

title: Watch: What the NDA victory means for Bihar’s economy — and its fiscal discipline | Business Matters
content: The NDA alliance swept the polls in Biahr. What will this mean for Bihar’s economy in the coming months? It’s highly likely we will notice what is now a pattern across States. Not just Bihar but most other States in India see some slippage when it comes to fiscal discipline. Here’s a peek into how this happens.

title: Stalemate over third round of counselling of MBBS, BDS courses continues as Karnataka High Court delivers divergent verdict on KEA’s procedure
content: The petitions, filed by some of the candidates challenging the procedure of allotment in the third round, will be heard by a third judge and till then the counselling process for 900 seats will be on hold

title: Karnataka government to train women who’ve taken career breaks in semiconductor industry
content: The training programme is mostly designed for women who have taken a career break and still want to get back to work after a sabbatical of some years

title: U.P. ATS seeks details on madrassas; opposition alleges fear mongering
content: The inquiry has been criticised by opposition parties who allege attempts are being made to politicise security and portray every Muslim as a suspect

title: L&T to produce armoured vehicle BvS10 Sindhu for Indian Army at Hazira facility
content: The contract also includes a comprehensive integrated logistics support package for initial deployment, maintenance, and life-cycle sustainment, L&T said in a filing to BSE

title: Bombay HC slams Maharashtra govt for inaction on illegal constructions
content: Court terms mushrooming of illegal buildings a ‘grave concern’, warns State against being a passive spectator as homebuyers suffer.

title: Taliban’s trade Minister in Delhi amidst Afghanistan-Pakistan clashes to enhance sea connectivity
content: Alhaj Nooruddin Azizi has come with a large business delegation to strengthen bilateral trade and investment; India is keen on importing Afghan agriculture produce and minerals

title: Karnataka govt. notifies ward delimitation for five Bengaluru city corporations
content: The final notification revises the draft proposal, which suggested 368 wards, and raises the number to 369 by adding one more ward to the Bengaluru West City Corporation

title: Days after delivering death sentence for former PM Hasina, Bangladesh invites NSA Doval to visit Dhaka
content: Doval will host his counterparts from Maldives, Mauritius, Sri Lanka and Bangladesh at the Colombo Security Conclave, the Ministry of External Affairs said in an announcement

title: The forgotten 316 families in Kochi: victims of development speak out
content: The acquisition of land for ICTT connectivity displaced 316 families across seven villages spanning three Assembly constituencies and six local bodies in Ernakulam

title: Survivor pool strategy: Ravens, Seahawks among top options in Week 12
content: ESPN Eliminator Challenge is one of the most fun games to play this season . the rules are simple: pick one team, and as long as they win (or tie), you advance to the next round . fewer than 6% of entrants were knocked out last week, the lowest rate in any week all season. for the season, only nine underdogs of at least six points have won outright .

title: Alabama and JMU have something in common: anger about the CFP rankings
content: the ACC and the group of 5 will supply champions, too, whether the Big Ten likes it or not . the winner of a week 13 showdown between USC and Oregon should be on track for a bid . it's hard to imagine that Notre Dame is left out, given its no. 9 ranking .

title: Texas firmly out, Miami in limbo and the G5’s flavor of the week
content: the new rankings keep Ohio State at the top of the pile, while Texas Tech slides into the no. 5 spot in Week 13 . Notre Dame should buy some furniture and move in . the team's only win against a CFP-ranked team is against no. 15 USC .

title: Bracketology: Top seedings, bracket watch and more
content: conference tournaments are set to begin later this week . there are 31 automatic bids with 33 at-large teams chosen by the NCAA volleyball committee . the top eight teams in each region serve as first- and second-round hosts .

title: MMA P4P rankings: Shevchenko, Makhachev new No. 1s -- but just one unanimous
content: Valentina Shevchenko was no. 2 on the ESPN men's pound-for-pound rankings . the pair ascended to no. 1 after dominant victories at UFC 322 . Makhachev's opponent, Jack Della Maddalena, was ranked eighth among men .

title: Best stories, wildest celebrations from amazing round of qualifiers
content: the November international break delivered more than its fair share of thrills and spills as more national teams secured their place at the 2026 finals . the break produced a plethora of qualifying drama as tiny nations reached the finals for the first time, last-minute goals decided matches and a handful of major names tumbled by the wayside .

title: Inside the decision that will rock college football: What's next for Kiffin?
content: coach Lane Kiffin says there is no ultimatum for him to make a decision on his coaching future . he posted a photo of a page from Brianna Wiest's self-development book, "the Pivot Year: 365 days to Become the Person You Truly Want to Be" he encouraged readers to make two lists, one of the positivists .

title: Panthers, Rangers reveal Winter Classic jerseys
content: the 17th NHL Winter Classic is scheduled for Jan. 2 at LoanDepot Park . it's the southernmost outdoor game ever played in the NHL . the Panthers' winter Classic jersey references the team's original "leaping panther" logo .

title: Anthony Yarde hoping third time's a charm in David Benavidez world title showdown
content: Anthony Yarde was stopped by artur Beterbiev and Sergey Kovalev in 2023 and 2019 respectively . the 34-year-old says he will be better in his third attempt at winning a world light heavyweight title on sunday . he was stopped in eight rounds for three versions of the world title, after lasting 11 rounds .

title: Delhi bomb scare: Multiple private schools receive threat emails; searches underway
content: The TOI City Desk is an indefatigable team of journalists dedicated to bringing you the pulse of cities from across the nation, all day and all night.
